params.subject: To check whether a particular chain is cursed, set to bytes16(uint128(chainSelector)).

setIsCursedRevert(bytes).details: Useful to test revert handling of ARMProxy

isBlessed((address,bytes32)).notice: Callers MUST NOT cache the return value as a blessed tagged root could become unblessed.

isCursed().notice: Iff there is an active global or legacy curse, this function returns true.

isCursed(bytes16).notice: Iff there is an active global curse, or an active curse for `subject`, this function returns true.

setIsCursedRevert(bytes).notice: Setting a revert error with length of 0 will disable reverts

documentation.text:
@notice Setting a revert error with length of 0 will disable reverts
 @dev Useful to test revert handling of ARMProxy
@notice WARNING: This contract is to be only used for testing, all methods are unprotected.
